summary: Data Science graduate passionate about building intelligent, data-driven solutions. Experienced in transforming real-world data into insights and developing predictive models to support smart decision-making. Focused on applying AI and analytics to drive innovation, enhance efficiency, and contribute to digital transformation goals.

experiences.title: Infrastructure Intern
bullets: Provided technical support and troubleshooting for internal IT systems and infrastructure tools.
Performed routine system checks and basic network diagnostics under supervision.
Shadowed data and AI team, gaining hands-on exposure to data pipelines and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Learned fundamentals of enterprise data flows and how structured data supports AI-driven decision-making.

experiences.title: Vice President of Computer Science and Engineering Club
bullets: Managed data records and optimized club activities.
Designed event plans and analyzed performance using Power BI dashboards.
Hosted the College Activities Awards Ceremony

projects.title: Disease Risk Prediction & Auto-Retraining Web Platform
projects.description: Developed a full-stack AI application to predict the risk of heart disease, diabetes, and breast cancer using custom-trained machine learning models. Integrated dynamic user input forms, model-based validation, and auto-retraining logic triggered after every 50 predictions.
bullets: Features: Flask-based web interface, data logging, auto-retraining with KNN + Random Forest, user feedback loop, multi-model architecture

projects.title: U.S. State Legal Cases Big Data Analysis
projects.description: Analyzed gigabyte-scale legal case data using Apache Spark and Hadoop to extract trends and anomalies.

other_sections: Completed internship at a national government authority (SAIP) in the infrastructure department
Selected as Vice President of the Computer Science & Engineering Club
Delivered multiple technical workshops and events for students in data science and AI
Worked part-time at the College of Computer Science, supporting labs and student development
